stem: The nurse is using a shared computer workstation in a busy clinical area. Which actions demonstrate adherence to 2026 digital security and patient privacy standards?

options.text: Positioning the monitor so that it is not visible to the public or visitors.
Sharing a unique login password with a colleague during a code blue emergency.
Reporting any observed 'tailgating' (unauthorized persons following staff into secure areas) to security.
Utilizing a privacy screen filter on all mobile charting devices.
Logging off the electronic health record (EHR) immediately after every use.
Closing the browser tab instead of selecting 'Log Out' to save time.

rationale.correct: Workstation security is a major focus of 2026 HIPAA updates. (A) Manual log-off is required to prevent unauthorized access if automatic timers fail. (B) Physical positioning prevents 'shoulder surfing' by the public. (D) Privacy filters are mandatory for mobile devices that may be used in public view. (F) Security awareness includes reporting physical breaches (tailgating) that could lead to unauthorized system access.
rationale.incorrect: (C) Passwords must *never* be shared, even in emergencies; most systems have 'emergency access' or 'break glass' protocols that do not require password sharing. (E) Closing a browser tab does not always terminate the session; always use the formal 'Log Out' or 'Sign Out' command.

answerBreakdown.label: A
answerBreakdown.content: "Positioning the monitor so that it is not visible to the public or visitors." represents a critical metric that must be monitored to evaluate the effectiveness of the current medical plan.

answerBreakdown.label: B
answerBreakdown.content: Selecting "Sharing a unique login password with a colleague during a code blue emergency." might delay more critical interventions, as it does not address the immediate life-threatening risk.

answerBreakdown.label: C
answerBreakdown.content: Selecting "Reporting any observed 'tailgating' (unauthorized persons following staff into secure areas) to security." is evidence-based as it directly correlates with the primary clinical cues and pathophysiology.

answerBreakdown.label: D
answerBreakdown.content: "Utilizing a privacy screen filter on all mobile charting devices." represents a critical metric that must be monitored to evaluate the effectiveness of the current medical plan.

answerBreakdown.label: E
answerBreakdown.content: "Logging off the electronic health record (EHR) immediately after every use." represents a critical metric that must be monitored to evaluate the effectiveness of the current medical plan.

answerBreakdown.label: F
answerBreakdown.content: Choosing "Closing the browser tab instead of selecting 'Log Out' to save time." represents a misinterpretation of the gathered cues or a failure to prioritize physiological needs.

clinicalPearls: Automatic log-offs are a backup, not a primary security measure. Always log off manually.

questionTrap.howToOvercome: NCLEX almost never allows a security or safety breach 'because it was an emergency.' Professional standards (like password privacy) are absolute.

mnemonic.title: S-L-O-W
mnemonic.expansion: Screen privacy, Log off, Only your password, Watch for intruders.

reviewUnits.heading: Cybersecurity in Healthcare
reviewUnits.body: Nurses are the front line against data breaches. Human error (like failing to log off) is the leading cause of healthcare data exposure.
